block.p: In another move to consolidate control over its holdings in South Africa, Cadbury Schweppes, the British beverage and candy company, said it planned to acquire the outstanding 45 percent stake in its South African subsidiary for about $207 million. Cadbury said that Tempora Investments Ltd., which holds nearly half of the minority stake in the South African company, had agreed to the deal, which follows Cadbury's sale of its South African soft drink business last year to Coca-Cola.
